gurmukhi: bhuro hl mUsl lY kir mo Air isau Air kY Aiq ju`D mcwXo ]lY brCw gij isMG blI bil isau bldyv kI Er clwXo ]
transliteration: Bahuro Lal Moondal Lai Kar(i) Mo Ar(i) Sio Ar(i) Kai At(i) Juddh Machadyo|| Lai Barchhaadgad(i) Singh Balibal(i) Sio Baldev Kior Chalaayo||
translation: Taking his plough and mace, Balram fought a dreadful battle and on this side Gaj Singh also threw his lance towards Balram;

gurmukhi: Awvq so liK kY Pl ko hl so kit kY pun BUm igrwXo ]so Pl hIn BXo jbhI kis kY blB`dR ky gwq lgwXo ]1132]
transliteration: Oovat So Lakh(i) Kai Phal Ko Hal So Kattee Kai Poun Bhoom Giraayo|| So Phal Heen Bhayo Jab-hikas(i) Kai Balbhaddra Ke Gadt Lagadyo||1132||
translation: Seeing the coming lance, Balram intercepted it with his plough and threw its blade on the ground; and that bladeless lance came and struck the body of Balram.1132.

gurmukhi: K`g krMgih kY gij isMG AMnq ky aUpr kop clwXo ]qau muslI kr crm lIXo Dr XoN Air kau bl Gwau bcwXo ]
transliteration: Khagg Karanad(i) Kai Gad(i) Singh Anant Ke Oopar Kop Chalaayo|| Tau Mouslikar Charam Leeyo Dhar Yon Ar(i) Kau Bal Ghaao Bahaayo||
translation: When Gaj Singh in his rage struck a blow with his sword from which Balram saved himself with his shield;

gurmukhi: Fwl ky PUl pY Dwr bhI icngwr auTI kib XoN gun gwXo ]mwnhu pwvs kI ins mY ibjurI duiq qwrn ko pRgtwXo ]1133]
transliteration: Dhaal Ke Phool Pai Dhaar Bahichingadr Outhikabi Yon Goun Gadyo|| Maanoh Paavas Kinis Mai Bijuridout(i) Taaran Ko Pragtaayo||1133||
translation: The sparkles came out from the shield, which appeared like flashing lightning during night exhibiting the stars in rainy reason.1133.

gurmukhi: Gwie hlI sh kY irp ko gih kY krvwr su bwr krXo hY ]Dwr bhI Air kMiT ibKY kit kY iqh ko isr BUm JrXo hY ]
transliteration: Ghaae Halisah Kai Rip Ko Gadh Kai Karvaar Su Baar Daryo Hai|| Dhaar Bahiar(i) Kanth(i) Bikhai Kattee Kai Tih Ko Sir Bhoom Jdaryo Hai||
translation: Enduring the wound inflicted by the enemy, Balram struck a blow with his sword; the edge of the sword struck the throat of the enemy and his head, being chopped, fell on the ground;

gurmukhi: b`jR jry rQ qy igrXo iqh ko js XO kib nY aucrXo hY ]mwnhu qwrn lokhUM qy sur Bwn hnXo isr BUim prXo hY ]1134]
transliteration: Bajjra Dare Rath Te Giryo Tih Ko Jas You Kabi Nai Ouchryo Hai|| Maanoh Taaran Lok-hoon Te Sur Bhaan Hanyo Sir Bhoom(i) Daryo Hai||1134||
translation: He fell from his chariot after receiving the blow of Vajra (the weapon) and the poet says, while describing that spectacle that it appeared to him that for the welfare of the people, Vishnu had cut off the head of Rahu and thrown it on the earth.1134.

gurmukhi: mwr lXo gij isMG jbY qij kY rn ko sB hI Bt Bwgy ]sRaun Bry liK loQ fry nih DIr Dry ins ky jnu jwgy ]
transliteration: Maar Layo Gad(i) Singh Jabai Taj(i) Kai Ran Ko Sabh Hibhat Bhaage|| Sraoun Bhare Lakh(i) Loth Dare Nah(i) Dheer Ddare Nis Ke Jan(u) Jaage||
translation: When Gaj Singh was killed, then all the warriors, ran away from the battlefield; seeing his corpse besmeared with blood, all of them lost the power of endurance and were bewildered as if they had not slept for several nights;

gurmukhi: mwr ley niRp pMc Bgy iqn XoN khXo jw Apny pRiB Awgy ]XoN suin kY dl DIr CutXo niRp hIXo PtXo irs mY Anurwgy ]1135]
transliteration: Maar Lae Nrip Panch Bhage Tin Yon Kahyo Jaa Apne Prabh(i) Aage|| Yon Soun(i) Kai Dal Dheer Chhoutyo Nrip Heeyo Phatyo Ris Mai Anuraage||1135||
translation: The warriors of the enemy’s army came to their Lord Jarasandh and said, “All the chief kings have been killed in the battlefield;” hearing these words, the remining army lost their endurance and in great anger, the king experienced an unbearable sorrow.11

gurmukhi: ieiq kiRSnwvqwry ju`D pRwrMB gj isMG bDih iDAwie smwpqm ]
transliteration: It(i) Karishnaavatdare Juddh Praaranbh Gad Singh Badhah(i) Dhiaae Samaaptam||
translation: End of the Chapter entitled “Killing of Gaj Singh in the beginning of war” in Krishnavatara.

gurmukhi: AQ Aimq isMG sYnw sihq bDih kQnM ]
transliteration: Ath Amit Singh Sainaa Sahit Badhah(i) Kathanan||
translation: Now begins the description of the killing of Amit Singh with army
